histogram.name: Glic.Actor.JournalEvent.{EventType}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a glic async journal event is ended.

histogram.name: Glic.Api.FetchZeroStateSuggestionsLatency
histogram.summary: Records the latency of fetching zero state suggestions whenever the glic web client requests zero state suggestions from Chrome.

histogram.name: Glic.Api.NotifyPanelWillOpen
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the glic web client returns from being notified that the panel will open. Records the active web client mode.

histogram.name: Glic.Api.RequestCounts.Error
histogram.summary: Recorded when a glic API fails with an exception.

histogram.name: Glic.Api.RequestCounts.Hidden
histogram.summary: Recorded when a glic API is called while the client is not being shown. Reported regardless of whether the call was successful.

histogram.name: Glic.Api.RequestCounts.Received
histogram.summary: Recorded when a glic API is called. Reported regardless of whether the call was successful.

histogram.name: Glic.Api.RequestCounts.{ApiRequestType}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a glic API request event has occurred. See GlicRequestEvent.

histogram.name: Glic.Api.TabData.UpdatesPerNavigation
histogram.summary: The number of tab data updates sent by TabDataObserver while on each web page. Recorded when a cross-document navigation completes, or when tab data is no longer observed.

histogram.name: Glic.Api.UseCounter
histogram.summary: Records a use counter histogram. Each sample represents a single RecordUseCounter call the front end has made.

histogram.name: Glic.Api.{TabContextOperation}.Error.{Mode}
histogram.summary: Records errors that occurred while attempting to extract tab context using {TabContextOperation} while the web client was in {Mode}.

variant.name: GetContextForActorFromTab
variant.summary: GetContextForActorFromTab (context from an arbitrary tab for an actor)

histogram.name: Glic.AttachedToBrowser
histogram.summary: Record the reason for attaching the panel to a browser when the panel is attached.

histogram.name: Glic.ChromeClient.MultiProfileSyntheticTrialConflictDetected
histogram.summary: Recorded when different Chrome profiles using glic attempt to register conflicting synthetic field trial groups in the same log file. This should only happen on multi profile installs that use glic on different profiles in quick succession. When analyzing metrics from a synthetic field trial this histogram will allow us to create custom queries to filter out users who may have contaminated logs from multiple profiles.

histogram.name: Glic.DetachedFromBrowser
histogram.summary: Record the reason for detaching the panel from a browser when the panel is detached.

histogram.name: Glic.EntryPoint.Status
histogram.summary: Recorded every 15 minutes, but only if the glic feature flag is enabled. This is a rough estimate of whether a user is seeing an impression of glic entry points. There are three entry points for glic: Tabstrip, OS, and Three-Dot. The entry points are only shown if a profile is eligible to use glic. The Three-Dot menu entry is always shown but the Tabstrip and OS entrypoints can be removed based on user configuration.

histogram.name: Glic.FirstReaction.Text.{ReactionType}.Time
histogram.summary: Recorded when the first reaction is rendered after a user input was made in text mode. Measures the time from a user's submitted input until a response starts and was visible to the user. Reported once for each type, only on the first reaction of each user input.

histogram.name: Glic.Focus.Settings.Shortcut.Customized
histogram.summary:
After the user modifies the glic focus shortcut, logs a boolean that reflects whether a shortcut is set.
Note: When setting a shortcut, 'disabled' will always be logged, then 'enabled'. This is because the edit process first clears the existing value. If the shortcut is cleared, only a single 'disabled' log entry is generated.

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.InteractionTime.Accepted
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed between the FRE being fully loaded (the Ready state) and the user clicking the accept/continue button. This is logged when the user accepts the FRE.

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.InteractionTime.Dismissed
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed between the FRE being fully loaded (the Ready state) and the user dismissing the dialog through an indirect action (e.g., closing the tab, pressing Esc, clicking outside the dialog).

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.InteractionTime.NoThanks
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed between the FRE being fully loaded (the Ready state) and the user explicitly clicking the No thanks button. This is logged when the user rejects the FRE.

histogram.name: Glic.FRE.InvocationSource
histogram.summary: Records the entry point used to trigger the opening of the glic FRE modal. Recorded when the FRE is shown to the user.

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.TotalTime.Accepted
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed from when the FRE is first opened until the user accepts it.

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.TotalTime.Dismissed
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed from when the FRE is first opened until it is dismissed by the user (e.g. closing the tab).

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.TotalTime.NoThanks
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed from when the FRE is first opened until the user clicks the No Thanks button.

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.WebClientLoadTime
histogram.summary: Records the time from when the Glic FRE WebUI begins loading the remote content until the WebUI reports itself as fully loaded and ready.

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.WebUiFrameworkLoadTime
histogram.summary: Records the time from when the Glic FRE native widget is visible until the local WebUI framework has loaded and is ready to load the remote web content.

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.WebUITerminationStatus
histogram.summary: Records the termination status of the FRE WebUI process. This is logged when the WebUI process associated with the FRE is terminated for any reason.

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.WebviewLoadAbortReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the FRE webview failed to load. This is logged when the webview's `loadabort` event is fired.

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.WidgetClosedReason2
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the Glic FRE widget was closed. This is a successor to Glic.Fre.WidgetClosedReason and includes more detailed reasons related to tab movement and close in addition to the standard WidgetCloseReasons from before.

histogram.name: Glic.Fre.WidgetCreationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to create and show the native Glic FRE dialog widget. This measures the performance of the native UI code before the web content begins to load.

histogram.name: Glic.FreErrorStateReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason the error panel was shown. This is recorded either before the FRE is shown if its an issue during auth, or after loading times out.

histogram.name: Glic.FreModalWebUiState.FinishState2
histogram.summary: Record the current state of the FRE modal when it closes.

histogram.name: Glic.FrePresentationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken for content to load after the FRE window appears.

histogram.name: Glic.FreToFirstQueryTime
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed between the successful completion of the FRE and the first submitted query. This is logged only once per profile that accepted the FRE, when the user submits their first glic request (without restarting Chrome in between).

histogram.name: Glic.FreToFirstQueryTimeMax24H
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed between the successful completion of the FRE and the first submitted query. This records the same information as Glic.FreToFirstQueryTime but here we have a max time bucket of 24 hours instead of 1 hour.

histogram.name: Glic.Host.LoadingStageAtTimeOut
histogram.summary: Histogram that records which loading stage the glic host was in when loading timed out. Only recorded when loading fails due to timeout.

histogram.name: Glic.Host.LoadingStageDuration.{LoadingStage}
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a particular loading step took to complete. {LoadingStage}

histogram.name: Glic.Host.OpenedInRegularTab
histogram.summary: Histogram that records whether the Glic WebUI is being opened in a regular browser tab (records true; expected for development purposes) instead of its expected container types (records false). Recorded when the web client is about to be notified about it being opened.

histogram.name: Glic.Host.WebClientState.{Event}
histogram.summary: Records the web client state according to the host. {Event}

variant.name: AtOneMinute
variant.summary: Recorded one minute after loading the webview.

variant.name: OnCommit
variant.summary: Recorded before commit on the webview.

variant.name: OnDestroy
variant.summary: Recorded before the webview is destroyed.

histogram.name: Glic.Host.WebClientUnresponsiveState
histogram.summary: Tracks the detection of the web client being unresponsive and the respective state transitions into and out of the unresponsive state. Reported upon detection of unresponsiveness and unresposive state transitions.

histogram.name: Glic.Host.WebClientUnresponsiveState.Duration
histogram.summary: Records for how long the web client was kept in an unresponsive state. Recorded when the state is swtiching from unresponsive to any other supported state.

histogram.name: Glic.Host.WebView.AutoPlay
histogram.summary: Debug histogram that tracks the internal steps that lead to the granting of AutoPlay permissions to the renderer frame hosting Glic's embedded webview. Samples are recorded when their respective events take place.

histogram.name: Glic.MaybeReplaceNavigation.Result
histogram.summary: Records the boolean result of calling MaybeReplaceNavigation. This is used to determine if a navigation was replaced with a media viewer.

histogram.name: Glic.Media.ContextLength
histogram.summary: Recorded when media context is collected by glic. Represents the total media context length for the page at the time it was requested, including any that was previously truncated for length restrictions.

histogram.name: Glic.Media.TimestampRangeCount
histogram.summary: Recorded when a speech recognition result is received. Records the number of media timestamp ranges in the result. This can be greater than one, for example, around seeks. Zero means that there was no timing information, or the list of ranges was empty.

histogram.name: Glic.Metrics.Error
histogram.summary: Recorded when an unusual sequence of events is seen by glic metrics recorder. Usually replaces a real histogram event.

histogram.name: Glic.Metrics.Error{Cause}
histogram.summary:
Recorded when an unusual sequence of events is seen by glic metrics recorder, at the Response Stopped event. Usually replaces a real histogram event.
Limited to the following causes: {Cause}

variant.name: .Other
variant.summary: Other cause (infra) for stopping the response

histogram.name: Glic.Modal.DeepScanAccessPoint
histogram.summary: Recorded each time a Glic modal is created as a result of an Enterprise Connector deep scan trigger originating from ContentAnalysisDelegate::CreateForWebContents. The specific access point that triggered the scan is recorded. See the DeepScanAccessPoint enum in glic/enums.xml for possible values, corresponding to safe_browsing::DeepScanAccessPoint.

histogram.name: Glic.OsEntrypoint.Settings.Shortcut
histogram.summary:
After the user modifies the glic launcher shortcut, logs a boolean that reflects whether a shortcut is set.
Note: When setting a shortcut, 'disabled' will always be logged, then 'enabled'. This is because the edit process first clears the existing value. If the shortcut is cleared, only a single 'disabled' log entry is generated.

histogram.name: Glic.OsEntrypoint.Settings.ShortcutStatus
histogram.summary: Rough estimate of whether a user has a shortcut set. Recorded every 15 minutes, but only if the glic feature flag is enabled.

histogram.name: Glic.PageContextFetcher.GetAnnotatedPageContent
histogram.summary: Recorded when a page context gets annotated page content. Measure the time from start.

histogram.name: Glic.PageContextFetcher.GetEncodedScreenshot
histogram.summary: Recorded when a page context successfully gets a screenshot (post-encoding and scaling). Measure the time from start.

histogram.name: Glic.PageContextFetcher.GetEncodedScreenshot.Failure
histogram.summary: Recorded when a page context fails to get a screenshot. This includes any kind of error, including timeout. Measure the time from start.

histogram.name: Glic.PageContextFetcher.GetEncodedScreenshot.TimeoutAgnostic
histogram.summary: Recorded when a page context receives screenshot data (post-encoding and scaling) regardless of whether the timeout has already fired. Measure the time from start.

histogram.name: Glic.PageContextFetcher.GetInnerText
histogram.summary: Recorded when a page context gets inner text. Measure the time from start.

histogram.name: Glic.PageContextFetcher.GetScreenshot
histogram.summary: Recorded when a page context gets screenshot (pre-encoding and scaling). Measure the time from start.

histogram.name: Glic.PageContextFetcher.GetScreenshot.TimeoutAgnostic
histogram.summary: Recorded when a page context receives screenshot data (pre-encoding and scaling) regardless of whether the timeout has already fired. Measure the time from start.

histogram.name: Glic.PageContextFetcher.Total
histogram.summary: Recorded when a page context fetcher finishes. Measure the time from start to finish.

histogram.name: Glic.PanelPresentationTime2.{InputMode}
histogram.summary: After glic is triggered, measure how long it takes to show the glic panel using the {InputMode} mode excluding the cases that require re-authentication. Desktop Chrome only (Windows and Mac).

histogram.name: Glic.PanelWebUi.ElapsedTimeBetweenSessions
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed time between the current and last session. Recorded when the Glic panel is opened.

histogram.name: Glic.PanelWebUi.Size.Area
histogram.summary: Records the area of the glic panel in DIPS. Recorded every 3 minutes while the panel is open.

histogram.name: Glic.PanelWebUi.Size.Height
histogram.summary: Records the height of the glic panel in DIPS. Recorded every 3 minutes while the panel is open.

histogram.name: Glic.PanelWebUi.Size.Width
histogram.summary: Records the width of the glic panel in DIPS. Recorded every 3 minutes while the panel is open.

histogram.name: Glic.PanelWebUi.UserResizeEnded.Height
histogram.summary: Records the height of the Glic panel in DIP when the user stops resizing the panel.

histogram.name: Glic.PanelWebUi.UserResizeEnded.Width
histogram.summary: Records the width of the Glic panel in DIP when the user stops resizing the panel.

histogram.name: Glic.PanelWebUi.UserResizeStarted.Height
histogram.summary: Records the height of the Glic panel in DIP when the user starts resizing the panel.

histogram.name: Glic.PanelWebUi.UserResizeStarted.Width
histogram.summary: Records the width of the Glic panel in DIP when the user starts resizing the panel.

histogram.name: Glic.PanelWebUiState
histogram.summary: Record the panel webui state any time it changes.

histogram.name: Glic.PanelWebUiState.FinishState2
histogram.summary: Record the current state when the the panel is closed.

histogram.name: Glic.PercentOverlapWithBrowser.{Event}
histogram.summary: Record the percent overlap of the Glic panel with the active Chrome window. Rounded to the nearest 10%. Recorded when {Event}.

histogram.name: Glic.PositionOnChrome.{Event}
histogram.summary: Record the position of the glic panel's center point relative to the active Chrome window. Recorded when {Event}.

histogram.name: Glic.PositionOnDisplay.{Event}
histogram.summary: Record the position of the glic panel relative to the current display where it's shown. The value Unknown is not expected to be recorded but is a backup. Recorded when {Event}.

histogram.name: Glic.Prewarming.ChecksResult
histogram.summary: Records the reason why Glic preloading was or was not attempted. Recorded each time we try to preload if the user has Glic enabled and went through the FRE.

histogram.name: Glic.PrewarmingFre.{PrewarmDisposition}PreloadFreForSource
histogram.summary: Records whether prewarming {PrewarmDisposition} be allowed for the given prewarming source, just before prewarming (or just after the decision not to prewarm is made).

variant.name: DisabledShouldNot
variant.summary: Should not prewarm because the feature flag was not enabled.

histogram.name: Glic.Response.Attached
histogram.summary: When glic returns a response to user input, whether glic was attached or detached at the time the response started. Only emitted if glic was visible when the response started.

histogram.name: Glic.Response.ClosedCaptionsShown
histogram.summary: Records if closed captions were being shown at the moment when glic returns a response to the user. Records true if the closed captions pref was enabled by the user; records false otherwise (an error condition).

histogram.name: Glic.Response.InputMode
histogram.summary: Recorded after a turn. Records the input mode of the original user input.

histogram.name: Glic.Response.InvocationSource
histogram.summary: Recorded after a turn. Records the source of the invocation of the glic window.

histogram.name: Glic.Response.Rated
histogram.summary: Recorded anytime a response is rated. There is no guarantee of correlation with any other Response.* metrics. This exists for diagnostic purposes only.

histogram.name: Glic.Response.Segmentation
histogram.summary: Recorded after a turn. Records the invocation source, attachment, and input mode.

histogram.name: Glic.Response.StartTime
histogram.summary: Recorded when a response starts and was visible. Measures the time from a user's submitted input until a response starts and was visible to the user.

histogram.name: Glic.Response.StartTime.InputMode.{Mode}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a response starts being presented to the user in {Mode}. Measures the time from when the user submitted input until a response starts being presented to the user.

histogram.name: Glic.Response.StartTime.TabContext.{ContextStatus}
histogram.summary:
Recorded when a response starts being presented to the user and {ContextStatus} (*). Measures the time from when the user submitted input until a response starts being presented to the user. This is reported for all web client modes (text or audio).
(*) Chrome knows if tab context was requested by the web client and the internal state of tabs' sharing status, but it cannot know for certain if tab context was or was not actually attached to requests by the web client.

variant.name: LikelyWith
variant.summary: tab context was likely used in the request

variant.name: LikelyWithout
variant.summary: tab context was likely NOT used in the request

histogram.name: Glic.Response.StopTime{Cause}
histogram.summary:
Measures the time from a user's submitted input until a response stops. There is no guarantee of correlation with Response.StartTime. This exists for diagnostic purposes only.
Limited to the following causes: {Cause}

variant.name: .Other
variant.summary: Other cause (infra) for stopping the response

histogram.name: Glic.Response.TabsPinnedForSharingCount
histogram.summary: Recorded after a turn. Records the number of tabs pinned for sharing at that time.

histogram.name: Glic.Response.TurnDuration.{Mode}
histogram.summary: Recorded at the end of a turn response from the server indicating the time the entire request/response sequence took.

variant.name: Actor
variant.summary: Recorded when the actor model is used.

variant.name: Default
variant.summary: Recorded when the default model is used.

histogram.name: Glic.ScrollTo.ErrorReason
histogram.summary: Records the error reason when scrollTo() fails.

histogram.name: Glic.ScrollTo.MatchDuration.{MatchResult}
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken to match content for scrollTo().

histogram.name: Glic.ScrollTo.ScrollDistance
histogram.summary: Records the scroll distance (in device independent pixels) for a scroll triggered by scrollTo()

histogram.name: Glic.ScrollTo.SessionCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of scrollTo() attempts in a single session. Currently configured to have a max recorded value of 100.

histogram.name: Glic.ScrollTo.UserPromptToScrollTime.{Mode}
histogram.summary: Records the time between when the user submitting input and a scroll (triggered by scrollTo()) starting, when the web client is in {Mode}.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.AttachStateChanges
histogram.summary: The number of times the panel was attached or detached between openning and closing. Recorded when the panel is closed.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.Duration
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from when the window opens until it is closed. Recorded each time the glic window is closed.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.InputModesUsed
histogram.summary: The input modes that were used during the session. Recorded when the panel is closed.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.InputSubmit.BrowserActiveState
histogram.summary: Records the browser active state when user input is submitted in a Glic session.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.Open.Attached
histogram.summary: Recorded when a session starts. Records whether the window is attached.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.Open.BrowserActiveState
histogram.summary: Records the browser active state when a Glic session starts.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.Open.InvocationSource
histogram.summary: Recorded when a session starts. Records the source of the invocation.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.ResponseCount
histogram.summary: The number of responses during the session. Recorded when the panel is closed.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.ResponseStart.BrowserActiveState
histogram.summary: Records the browser active state when a Glic response starts rendering.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.WebClientCrash.ExitReason
histogram.summary: Records the exit reason of the Glic webview. This is logged when the webview's `exit` event is fired.

histogram.name: Glic.Session.WebUiCrash.TerminationStatus
histogram.summary: Records the termination status of the Glic WebUI process. This is logged when the WebUI process associated with Glic is terminated for any reason.

histogram.name: Glic.Sharing.ActiveTabSharingState.{Event}
histogram.summary: Records the active tab's focus state at the moment when {Event}.

variant.name: OnPanelOpenAndReady
variant.summary: the Glic panel has been opened and is ready to receive user input

variant.name: OnTabContextPermissionGranted
variant.summary: the user grants tab context access to Glic while the panel is open

histogram.name: Glic.Sharing.TabPinnedForSharing
histogram.summary: Records when a tab is attempted to be pinned for sharing with Glic. Records true if the pinning was successful; records false otherwise.

histogram.name: Glic.TabContext.PdfContentsRequested
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the glic web client requests to obtain PDF contents from the focused tab. Records an enum sample that answers a) is the main document a PDF (based on its MIME type) and b) were PDF contents actually found within the web page (only if Chrome's PDF plugin is actually active).

histogram.name: Glic.TabContext.ShareImageDuration
histogram.summary: Recorded when an attempt to send an image as context to glic is completed. Precisely, this records the time from the start of an image context sharing request until when the data finishes being sent via glic.mojom. It does not capture any subsequent processing time by the web client. This is not recorded if sharing fails.

histogram.name: Glic.TabContext.ShareImageResult
histogram.summary: Recorded after an attempt is made to share an image with glic.

histogram.name: Glic.TabContext.UploadTime
histogram.summary: Recorded when the glic web client reports that it has completed uploading all necessary tab context. Reports the time taken to upload. Note that upload may happen none or many times for any given query, and this may report the wrong timings if the web client performs concurrent upload operations.

histogram.name: Glic.TieredRolloutEnablementStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether the Glic-eligible profiles are enabled for tiered rollout. Emitted in every UMA record from the current session (at the time the record is finalized), but only if there is at least one Glic-eligible profile.

histogram.name: Glic.Usage.Hotkey
histogram.summary: Records whether the user is using the default or custom hotkey. Recorded when the user presses the hotkey.
